page.title: 13TABLEY ESTATE AND PARKLAND.
page.content: THE ESTATE AND PARKLAND OF TABLEY ARE VERY PEACEFUL,THEY ARE PRIVATELY OWNED AND ARE NOT OPEN TO THE PUBLIC. SPECIAL PERMISSION HAS TO BE OBTAINED TO WALK THROUGH THE GROUNDS. THERE ARE LOTS OF WILDLIFE IN THE PARKLAND SUCH AS RABBITS,GUINEA FOWL,PHEASANT,THE OCCASIONAL HARE AND BADGERS.THERE IS A HERONRY AND SEVERAL CAN BE SEEN FISHING AT THE SIDE OF THE MERE. THE CROPS GROWING IN THE FIELD INCLUDE WHEAT,BARLEY,RAPE AND POTATOES.A BIRD SCARER,WHICH MADE A NOISE LIKE A GUN,HAD REPLACED A SCARECROW IN A FIELD.
